item.title: Dual South Korean listings send Ethereum layer-2 token AZTEC surging 82%
item.description: Korean exchanges Upbit and Bithumb both added local currency pairs for the privacy-focused layer-2 token, triggering a sharp move in a thinly traded market.

item.title: Panic premium lingers in options even as bitcoin recovers from lows
item.description: Bitcoin rebounded above $68,000 as ETF outflows hit $6.8 billion and funding flips positive. A break above $72,000 is needed to confirm a bullish shift.

item.title: Bitcoin ETFs Lose Another $166M as Five-Week Withdrawals Near $4B
item.description: Bitcoin ETF outflows near $4 billion over the past five weeks, as experts debate whether the streak signals a reset or structural weakness.

item.title: Silicon Valley Engineers Charged With Theft of Google, Tech Trade Secrets
item.description: Three engineers are accused of stealing sensitive mobile processor and cryptography files from Google and two other companies.

item.title: Metaplanet CEO rejects claims it hid details of Bitcoin trades
item.description: Metaplanet‚Äôs Simon Gerovich addressed critics who accused the company of hiding losses and key details of its Bitcoin bets, as investor anger over leveraged Bitcoin treasuries spreads.

item.title: South Korean authorities under fire over $43B Bithumb Bitcoin error
item.description: Lawmakers criticize South Korea‚Äôs Financial Services Commission after Bithumb mistakenly credited 620,000 BTC and the probe faces delays.

item.title: Ripple's Brad Garlinghouse says CLARITY bill has '90% chance' of passing by April
item.description: The bill would clarify which digital assets fall under securities law versus Commodity Futures Trading Commission oversight.

item.title: Bitcoin difficulty jumps 15% largest increase since 2021, despite price slump
item.description: Bitcoin difficulty rebounds to 144.4T as hashrate recovers to 1 ZH/s despite multi year low hashprice.

item.title: Bitcoin nears $68,000, gold jumps as U.S.-Iran tensions return
item.description: Geopolitical tensions and a cautious tone in U.S. stocks are keeping risk appetite in check, and some strategists warn of a potential retest of 2024 lows before a more sustained recovery.

item.title: Parsec shuts down amid ongoing crypto market volatility
item.description: The on-chain analytics firm‚Äòs focus on decentralized finance and non-fungible tokens had fallen out of step with the industry‚Äòs current trajectory.

item.title: Bitcoin logs worst first 50-day start to a year on record
item.description: Bitcoin is on course for its first ever back to back declines in January and February.

item.title: Metaplanet CEO rebuts critics over bitcoin strategy and transparency
item.description: Simon Gerovich defends disclosure standards, options trading model, and hotel operations.

item.title: White House floats limited stablecoin rewards in third crypto, bank meeting
item.description: White House crypto adviser Patrick Witt reportedly refocused crypto and bank lobby talks on a crypto bill to allow stablecoin rewards tied to transaction activity.

item.title: Custodia CEO Says Trump Family Crypto Ties Are Part of Clarity Act Problem
item.description: At ETH Denver, Caitlin Long said the ethics controversy around Trump-linked crypto projects has complicated Senate support.

item.title: Crypto miner Bitdeer tanks 17% after $300M debt offering
item.description: Bitdeer has launched its second-ever convertible senior note offering, which has seen its shares tumble 29% so far this year.

item.title: Risk-Off Capital Shifts Toward Tokenized Assets as DeFi Pulls Back
item.description: Capital is rotating out of DeFi into tokenized assets as experts say the shift reflects maturing markets, not capitulation.

item.title: Illicit stablecoin activity hit 5-year high of $141B in 2025: TRM Labs
item.description: Sanctions evasion networks, guarantee marketplaces, and large-scale money laundering schemes dominated illicit stablecoin use, says TRM Labs.

item.title: Quantum fears aren‚Äôt behind Bitcoin‚Äôs 46% drop, says developer
item.description: Bitcoin developer Matt Carallo says Bitcoiners are looking to ‚Äúblame something‚Äù for the asset‚Äôs sluggish price, dismissing quantum fears as the culprit.

item.title: Australian Executive Accused of Selling Cyber Secrets to Russia for Crypto
item.description: U.S. prosecutors say the former defense contractor executive took about $1.26 million in crypto to transfer sensitive exploit tools tied to Five Eyes intelligence work.

item.title: AI agents not worth the cost as humans still cheaper: Tech execs
item.description: Jason Calacanis says he‚Äôs spending about $110,000 a year on an AI agent that runs at a fraction of capacity, raising doubts about replacing human workers.

item.title: White House, Banks and Crypto Groups Resume Talks on Stablecoin Rewards
item.description: Stablecoin incentives remain a key unresolved issue as lawmakers seek to advance digital-asset market-structure legislation.

item.title: Bitcoin options market structure leans toward $60K retest in February
item.description: Bitcoin may stay capped under $70,000 as traders deploy bearish options strategies, and spot BTC ETF outflows point to a retest of the yearly low.

item.title: 'Warhammer' Veteran Jervis Johnson Warns AI Could Become the 'Asbestos of the Internet'
item.description: The longtime Warhammer designer backed Games Workshop‚Äôs generative AI ban, arguing the technology undermines creative work.

item.title: Kraken‚Äôs xStocks tops $25B in volume with more than 80K onchain holders
item.description: Blockchain-based versions of US stocks are drawing growing investor activity, with onchain wallets and cross-venue trading expanding rapidly.

item.title: AI in Hollywood? 'Silicon Valley' Star T.J. Miller Isn't Worried
item.description: ‚ÄúSilicon Valley‚Äù actor T.J. Miller joked that an AI bot ‚Äúreplaced‚Äù him as this week‚Äôs ETH Denver host, amid actual growing job fears.

item.title: Bitcoin Lightning Network exceeds $1B in monthly volume: Report
item.description: Analysis by Bitcoin services company River forecasts a transaction surge as individuals and businesses experiment with AI agentic payments.

item.title: Bitcoin‚Äôs monthly losses break records, but history says a turnaround is brewing
item.description: Bitcoin is on course to lock in another negative month, but one analyst says major differences in the current market structure could be a sign of a pending trend reversal.

item.title: Bitcoin steadies near $67,000 as traders pay for crash protection
item.description: The average bitcoin ETF investor now sits on a 20% paper loss, leaving the market vulnerable to capitulation selling if prices slide further, a Wintermute trader said.

item.title: Google Brings AI Music Generation to Gemini‚ÄîWe Tried It, and It's Too Little Too Late
item.description: Google AI music generator Lyria 3 is now available on the Gemini app. It works‚Äîmostly‚Äîbut the competition has a big head start.

item.title: SEC leaders seek to clarify how tokenized securities interact with existing regulation
item.description: Paul Atkins and Hester Peirce spoke at ETHDenver on Wednesday on the future of regulation at the SEC and its response to crypto market volatility.

item.title: Community banks see net deposit outflows to Coinbase: Study
item.description: A transaction-level analysis of 92 community banks found $78.3 million in net deposits moved to Coinbase over 13 months, with money market accounts losing most outflows.

item.title: Tightening Bitcoin Bollinger Bands forecast explosive price move, but which way?
item.description: The Bollinger Bands indicator has narrowed to its tightest level on record, a rare technical setup that analysts say is a sign of a pending directional move.

item.title: ProShares seeks stablecoin reserves with GENIUS Act-compliant Treasury ETF
item.description: The ETF invests exclusively in short-term US Treasurys and is structured for potential use by stablecoin issuers under US reserve requirements.

item.title: Ethereum Treasury Sharplink Reports Growing ETH Holdings, Institutional Investment
item.description: Sharplink is shaking up its branding as it reports additional Ethereum holdings and a rising number of institutional investors.

item.description: Crypto gaming metaverse platform The Sandbox is rolling out its Season 7 content push, making it easier than ever for players to jump in.

item.title: Latest White House talks on stablecoin yield make 'progress' with banks, no deal yet
item.description: In the latest of a series of meetings hosted at the White House, bankers and crypto policy experts met to break down the wall halting the market structure bill.

item.title: Bitcoin ETFs still sit on $53B in net inflows despite recent outflows: Bloomberg
item.description: Heavy outflows haven‚Äôt erased the success of spot Bitcoin ETFs, which still hold $53 billion in cumulative inflows, according to Bloomberg analyst Eric Balchunas.

item.description: Consulting giant Accenture is monitoring senior staff logins to AI tools and tying career advancement to adoption rates‚Äîall while AI threatens to eliminate jobs.

item.description: The Chicago-based company said it was temporarily suspending client deposits and withdrawals last week due to recent market and financial conditions.

item.description: The longtime crypto critic warned against using taxpayer dollars to rescue investors and firms amid the current market slide.

item.title: CME Will Make Crypto Derivatives Trading 24/7 in May as Wall Street Eyes Similar Goal
item.description: Top derivatives marketplace CME will adopt 24/7 crypto trading on May 29, pending regulatory approval. The CFTC has indicated it supports such moves.

item.description: Crypto bank Anchorage Digital is launching U.S.-compliant stablecoin rails for international banks, offering faster movement of assets across borders.
